entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone in Integrated Product Development: A Step-by-Step Setup Guide
entry.content:
Why SAP Build Work Zone for IPD?

In complex IPD environments, teams work with various applications, from CAD systems to PLM tools and collaboration platforms. SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition provides a central access point for all enterprise applications and reduces complexity for end users. The platform enables the creation of role-based, personalized business sites with flexible content structures.

Prerequisites

Before starting the setup, ensure the following prerequisites are met:

  • SAP BTP Subaccount: An active SAP Business Technology Platform subaccount with appropriate permissions
  • Administrator Rights: Subaccount administrator or corresponding roles for configuration
  • SAP Cloud Identity Services: Access to Identity Authentication Services (IAS) for user management

Step-by-Step Setup Guide

1. Start Booster for SAP Build Work Zone

Navigate to the "Boosters" section in your SAP BTP Cockpit and search for "SAP Build Work Zone". The booster automates the basic configuration steps for your subaccount.

2. Select Subaccount

Choose the appropriate subaccount where SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition should be set up.

3. Start your application "SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition"

4. Create and Name Website

5. Link Launchpad_Admin Role with Identity Services

For role management, navigate in the cockpit side panel to:

  • Security â†’ Trust Configuration
  • Click on the tenant you created in SAP Cloud Identity Services

  • A screen opens on the right side - click on the "Attribute Mappings" tab and then "Edit"

  • Under the "Role Collection" column, select the Launchpad_Admin role from the dropdown list

  • Enter "Groups" as attribute and "Admin" as value. Click "+" to add the attributes and save

The mapping is complete. You can now access SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition.

Create a Site

When you create a site, you'll be redirected to the Site Studio Site Settings screen. By enabling "Spaces and Pages â€“ New Experience" view mode, you can create spaces and pages locally in dedicated editors.

  • Click "Edit" in the upper right corner of the Site Settings screen
  • Under "Display" select "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"

  • Go to Site Directory to view the site tile

Your site is empty.

General Process

The general process is structured in the following steps: Apps â†’ Pages â†’ Spaces â†’ Roles â†’ Users

Configure Apps

Click the Content Manager icon in the side panel to open the Content Manager. You'll see a list of content elements added to your subaccount.

  • Go to Content Explorer and select your content
  • Choose the channel for your content

  • Select the channel functionalities and add them to your content

  • After adding functionalities from various applications, add them to your own content

Create Pages

  • Create a page

  • Add a name for the page, description, header, and select relevant widgets

  • Create this for all other necessary applications for IPD

Create Spaces

1. First decide whether one or multiple spaces are necessary

Check your requirements:

  • Do all users have the same access rights?
  • Do you need different security levels?

â†’ One space with multiple pages is optimal in most cases. Multiple spaces mean exponentially higher administrative complexity.

a) Create one space
Content Manager â†’ Create â†’ Space

  • Add title: e.g., "IPD Workspace", add description
  • Assign pages to space: activate assignment status for all pages
  • Order by priority
  • Save

b) Create multiple spaces
Content Manager â†’ Create â†’ Space:

  • "Collaboration Space"
  • "Specification Management Space"

2. Assign space to Everyone role
Content Manager â†’ Everyone â†’ Edit â†’ Spaces Tab:

  • Activate assignment status for space and save

3. Complete site configuration
Site Directory â†’ Site Settings â†’ Edit:

  • View Mode: "Spaces and Pages - New Experience"
  • Confirm Everyone role

Role Assignments

1. Perform role assignments

a) Use Everyone role when:

  • All users should have access to IPD apps
  • You need a simple, quick solution
  • No differentiated permissions are required

Procedure:

  • Assign apps to Everyone role (activate Assignment Status)
  • Done - no further BTP role assignments needed

b) Create custom IPD role

  • Click Edit in Site Settings

  • In the Assignments area, add your created role ("+" symbol)

Additional Role Information

In addition to the setup steps described above, you can assign predefined roles to users for accessing specific applications within SAP Integrated Product Development. These role templates simplify permission management and ensure that users have access to the right tools and functionalities based on their responsibilities.

For more information, see the official SAP Help documentation: Role Templates for SAP Integrated Product Development .

  • Switch to BTP Cockpit
  • Navigate to Security â†’ Users
  • Select your user
  • Click "Assign Role Collection"
  • Search for your created role and assign it

Conclusion

SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition proves to be a central solution for IPD challenges. The systematic implementation - from booster configuration through structured apps, pages, and spaces to thoughtful role management - creates an efficient work environment.

In the next blog, I will detail the integration of SAP Joule into the Work Zone and show how AI-powered functions can further increase productivity in IPD processes.

entry.title: Leading SAP Business Warehouse modernization as a Solution Architect (data architecture miniseries)
entry.content:
Modernizing SAP BW isnâ€™t just a tech upgrade â€” itâ€™s a chance to simplify, boost agility, and unlock AI-ready insights.

Join the SAP Business Data Cloud Data Architecture Miniseries and discover how to lead SAP BW modernization with confidence.

In this session, weâ€™ll explore modernization pathways, real use-case patterns, and how SAP BW queries and models evolve into agile SAP BDC data products â€” powering advanced dashboards and AI/ML scenarios.

Plus, youâ€™ll get an overview of the free SAP BW to SAP BDC migration assessment, designed to help you map your transformation journey.

entry.title: Quick tip: event/task scheduling in CAP Node.js (in alpha state)
entry.content:
Quick tip: event/task scheduling in CAP Node.js (in alpha state)

This is just a quick note about a discovery I made in capire. SAP CAP (Node.js) will support task scheduling (including callbacks) for events (actions/functions are also events) in a future release. The feature is currently still in alpha state, so it may change.

The capire release notes for May 2025 mention one feature that I personally think could be extremely valuable in the future: event/task scheduling. See this section in capire for all the details. This is what it (currently) looks like:

await this.schedule("someEvent").every("2s")
this.after("someEvent/#succeeded", (data, req) => {
// do something
console.log(data)
})

This means you can set up you CAP applications to do things on a certain schedule, similar to a job scheduler. The application can emit events, or call actions/functions on its own without requiring another application or user to trigger it. I personally think this is a great addition to CAP and potentially very useful - especially if the think about AI agents that do things on their own, on a predefined schedule. This feature could be a starting point and building block for this.

Bold hypothesis: We might see CAP as the implementation foundation for (code-based) AI agents in the SAP ecosystem in the future. CAP is great for consuming (connecting) SAP systems and adding custom logic (code) to these connections. Time will tell.

Give it a try and let me know what you think! Keep in mind that this feature is still in alpha state and may change any time.

entry.title: Planning your transition paths to SAP Business Data Cloud (data architecture miniseries)
entry.content:
Modernizing your data landscape starts with a clear path to SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC).

Join this exclusive session for SAP Partners, part of the Data Architecture Miniseries, to explore proven architecture options and transition strategies that enable unified data operations, faster innovation, and insight-driven decision-making.

Weâ€™ll cover how SAP HANA Cloud integrates with SAP BDC to power hybrid innovation, connect data products across SAP Analytics Cloud and Databricks, and support both greenfield and phased modernization scenarios.

Youâ€™ll also gain access to complimentary SAP assessments that help you plan and execute a confident transition to SAP BDC.

entry.title: Influence the Next Wave of SAP BTP Innovation: Join the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative 2025-3
entry.content:
Transforming Enterprise Innovation with SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP)

SAP BTP is revolutionizing how businesses innovate. This integrated platform combines application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, and AI, empowering enterprises to achieve new levels of efficiency and intelligence.

Now, you can be a part of this transformation.

The third cycle of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative for 2025 is here, offering you the opportunity to shape the future of SAP BTP. As a customer or partner, youâ€™re invited to collaborate directly with SAP developers and product teams to influence upcoming features, tools, and innovations.

This is not just about early access; itâ€™s a chance to steer the direction of enterprise technology.

Donâ€™t wait - registration is open only until November 14, 2025.

Check out the full list here or follow the links below to discover the exciting opportunities:

  • Adoption of the SAP Job Scheduling service and it's new capabilities
  • AI-assisted message monitoring agent for SAP Integration Suite
  • Attachment handling made easy with SAP Document Management service CAP Plugin
  • CAP Apps and SAP BTP Kyma Runtime Environment
  • Effortlessly manage you documents using SAP Document Management service mobile application
  • Improving the Admin's and Solution Architect's Experience on SAP BTP
  • SAP Discovery Center: Long-Term User Research Initiative
  • Shape the future of job orchestration capabilities in SAP Build Process Automation
  • The impact of AI on SAP BTP users

Letâ€™s build the future together!

Innovation thrives through collaboration. By participating in the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative projects, you help SAP develop more effective and relevant solutions for businesses like yours. This is your chance to impact the future of enterprise technology.

Donâ€™t miss out - sign up today at influence.sap.com and be a part of the SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Cycle 3 in 2025!

Warm regards,

Your SAP Customer Engagement Initiative Team

Follow-up after registration: When you register for a project, you will be invited to an introductory call with the SAP project lead. Participation beyond this point is optional and typically governed by the Feedback Agreement with SAP.

entry.title: JOIN US: Meet SAP HANA Cloud @ SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Hi there! If you care about turning data into real business advantage, this oneâ€™s for you. TechEd airs next Tuesday, and our SAP HANA Cloud track is built to spark ideas, answer your toughest database and AI questions, and get you hands-on with the tools youâ€™ll use tomorrow. Join us in Berlin or online! Weâ€™d love to meet you!

  • This is more than theory â€” roadmap sessions and hands-on workshops show whatâ€™s coming in 2025 and beyond and how to apply it right away.

entry.title: The Unified Commerce Mandate: Leveraging SAP Technology to Achieve the 89% Retention Advantage
entry.content:
The era of multi-channel is over. Today's successful businesses rely on a connected SAP Intelligent Enterprise to eliminate friction and drive superior customer lifetime value (CLV).

 

Introduction: The Shift from Silo to System

The term "omni-channel" has long been synonymous with digital ambition, but its true significance has evolved. It is no longer a future-state strategy; it is a fundamental requirement of the Experience Economy. When a modern consumer engages with a brand, they expect a single, continuous conversation, regardless of whether the touchpoint is digital, physical, or voice.

This expectation is directly tied to business outcomes:

  • Customer Loyalty: Research indicates that enterprises with mature omni-channel engagement strategies achieve nearly 89% higher year-over-year customer retention rates compared to those with weak strategies. This loyalty directly translates to a 30% higher customer lifetime value (CLV).

  • Revenue Generation: Campaign performance also reflects this cohesion, with multi-channel campaigns resulting in a purchase rate increase of up to 287%. Furthermore, even traditional retail benefits, as digital omni-channel activity drives an approximate 80% increase in incremental visits to physical store locations.

The challenge, therefore, is structural: how do organisations consolidate disparate customer engagement systems and transactional data into one unified commerce platform?

The Solution Architecture: A Blueprint for Unified Commerce

Achieving this level of consistency requires a robust, scalable architecture that places the customer at the centre, integrating front-end engagement with back-end operations. This is the sweet spot of the SAP Intelligent Enterprise.

A. The Engagement Hub: SAP Commerce Cloud

SAP Commerce Cloud serves as the agile, API-first foundation for customer interaction. Its core strength is the ability to decouple the commerce engine from any single front-end presentation.

  • Headless Flexibility: This architecture allows businesses to quickly deploy commerce services to emerging channels (social, IoT, in-store screens) while ensuring that catalog, inventory, and pricing data remain consistent and centrally managed.

  • Fulfilment Optimisation: It is essential for enabling complex but critical omni-channel services such as Buy Online, Pick Up In-Store (BOPIS) and Ship-from-Store, which demand real-time synchronisation with logistics.

B. The Foundational Core: SAP Business Suite

Flawless omni-channel execution rests on accurate back-office data. SAP S/4HANA (the central pillar of the SAP Business Suite) provides the real-time, consolidated transactional system necessary for this execution.

  • By unifying financial, inventory, and supply chain data, S/4HANA guarantees that the inventory status shown to the customer on Commerce Cloud is instantly reflected across the enterprise, eliminating costly discrepancies and service failures.

C. The Integration & Extension Layer: SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)

The SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) is the critical middleware that eliminates data silos between the Commerce Cloud and the SAP S/4HANA core.

  • Integration Suite: Facilitates rapid, pre-built integration between SAP and non-SAP systems, ensuring a holistic flow of customer and order data.

  • Extensibility: BTP allows for the creation of custom applications (e.g., a bespoke in-store client for associates) that access unified data without disrupting the core business systems.

D. The Intelligence Engine: SAP AI Capabilities

To move beyond consistent service to truly contextual and predictive customer experiences, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is indispensable. SAP embeds AI across its portfolio:

  • SAP CX AI Toolkit: This powers personalisation through solutions like SAP Emarsys, enabling real-time product recommendations, personalised journeys, and optimised content based on unified customer data.

  • Intelligent Automation: SAP AI capabilities in the broader business suite enable predictive inventory management and automated demand forecasting, ensuring that the right product is in the right location to fulfil the promise made by the Commerce Cloud.

Conclusion

The mandate is clear: the market rewards unified, intelligent customer experiences. By leveraging SAP Commerce Cloud, SAP BTP, and the integrated power of SAP Business Suite and its AI capabilities, organisations can move beyond simply managing multiple channels to truly operating as an Intelligent Omni-Channel Enterprise, securing that vital customer loyalty and market growth.

SAP Commerce Cloud SAP HANA Enterprise Cloud SAP BTP, Kyma runtime SAP Commerce #S4HANA #SAPBTP SAP Business Suite #IntelligentEnterprise #CXAIToolkit #AI #BusinessAI Artificial Intelligence

entry.title: How Redwood Software and SAP are shaping the next era of automation with Joule Studio
entry.content:
Introduction

Over the past year, Redwood Software has taken major steps forward in our long-standing partnership with SAP, turning the vision of conversational, agentic automation into something you can see and use today.

As Field CTO at Redwood, Iâ€™ve spent many years helping SAP customers orchestrate their most critical workloads. Our shared mission with SAP has always been clear: make complex processes simpler, more reliable and, ultimately, autonomous.

Embedding automation into conversation with Joule Studio

In my previous post, I introduced how RunMyJobs by Redwood connects with SAP Joule Studio to transform automation into natural conversation. Since then, weâ€™ve built a tech preview that demonstrates a use case for how RunMyJobsâ€™ interoperability with SAP Joule makes agentic orchestration a reality you can scale for your most mission-critical processes.

One example is an autonomous, unplanned SAP system maintenance workflow. Traditionally, this requires multiple manual steps and cross-team coordination to pause background jobs, stop dependent integrations and verify dependencies. The SAP BTP team often has to schedule, stop or undeploy iFlows ad hoc, while the Basis team handles job suspension separately. Thus, itâ€™s a fragmented process filled with stress and risk.

Today, an SAP Basis administrator can take a more goal-oriented approach. They can simply tell Joule what they need to do: 

â€œSafely execute the SAP system maintenance procedure, including a pause on all dependent workflows associated with the system to avoid job failures.â€

Joule triggers the complete, pre-approved workflow across RunMyJobs and the relevant SAP systems. Acting as an interactive control tower for the entire event, it executes pre-approved RunMyJobs workflows, coordinates with integrations and provides real-time progress and approval updates through natural language with either business or IT users.

For example, Joule might respond: 

â€œAll background jobs are paused, and Integration Suite iFlows are offline. Do you approve the system restart now, or do you want to send an approval request to the system administrator for a restart?â€ 

Once the administrator confirms, the automated workflow proceeds to the next step.

ğŸ‘‰See Joule in action with RunMyJobs here:

 

What we learned building Joule skills

Working with Joule Studioâ€™s low-code design canvas confirmed how quickly governed automation can be delivered through conversational interfaces. Our approach focused on four essentials:

  1. Natural conversation design: Translating how SAP users actually phrase requests into machine-understandable prompts
  2. Action orchestration: Linking RunMyJobs APIs or pre-built SAP Accelerator Hub actions for pausing jobs, managing iFlows and performing restarts safely
  3. Context and safeguards: Supplying metadata so Joule executes only on the right systems, with test harnesses for edge cases
  4. Governed deployment: Leveraging accelerated compliance checks provided by RunMyJobsâ€™ SAP Endorsed App Premium certification to reliably execute controlled deployment across SAP environments

How RunMyJobs and Joule Studio connect

The integration between RunMyJobs and Joule Studio allows your teams to innovate safely across SAP environments and in various scenarios. The process looks like this:

  1. Publish operations in RunMyJobs, such as starting or pausing jobs.
  2. Publish actions to the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, making them available as reusable building blocks. 
  3. Secure access through SAP BTP using API keys and role-based permissions. You then govern access to these operations within the SAP BTP Cockpit. 
  4. Combine these actions in Joule Studio to build skills that connect automation with natural language requests.

This framework lets IT and business teams interact with automation directly in their workflow tools, so itâ€™s governed, auditable and ready for expansion.

The future of automation is a conversation

We are only at the starting line of whatâ€™s possible. The combination of RunMyJobs and SAP Joule is laying the foundation for agentic automation across finance, supply chain, HR, IT and beyond. As SAP continues to advance its Business AI capabilities, Redwood will keep embedding orchestration where it matters most: within the business conversation.

Learn more about how Redwood works with SAP solutions.

entry.title: The Next Generation SAP Enterprise Architect Learning Forum - February 23â€“26, 2026 at Newtown Sq. PA
entry.content:
If there is one event that every Enterprise Architect in the SAP ecosystem could choose to join, this should be the one.The Next Generation SAP Enterprise Architect Learning Forum 2026 is a 3.5-day multitrack conference hosted at SAP Americas' Newtown Square campus, Staring deep-dive pre-conference workshops on February 23, followed by three full days of agenda-driven sessions from February 24â€“27.

The learning forum is meant for SAP EAs to understanding current and emerging topics like transformation,  AI,  Evolution of Agents, Data Architecture, SAP Business Data Cloud,  and the Human Edge for expanding strategic influence of an Enterprise Architect.

Structured as a professional learning forum rather than a keynote-only event, it is designed to advance architectural mastery while strengthening the community shaping the future of SAP Enterprise Architecture.

You can mark your calendars already for the 2026 agenda while the registration is opening in the next 2 weeks.

You will have opportunity to join your peers, SAP experts, and industry thought leaders for four days of deep learning, hands-on sessions, and collaboration around the evolving role of the SAP Enterprise Architect.

This is a learning forum designed for Enterprise Architects, by Enterprise Architects. 

While we open the registrations for your to sign up, you can check out the following resources to give you an idea of the amazing sessions and speakers over last 2 years:

  1. Complete Agenda from Last year's ( Feb 2025) program : Explore last year's program
  2. YouTube Recordings of Next Generation EA Learning forum 2025
    1. Day 1 - Day 1 Next Gen EA Learning Forum 2025
    2. Day 2 - Day 2 Next Gen EA Learning Forum 2025
    3. Day 3 - Day 3 Next Gen EA Learning Forum 2025
  3. YouTube Recordings of Next Generation EA Learning Forum 2024
    1. Day 1 - Day 1 - Next Gen EA Forum 2024
    2. Day 3 - Day 3 - Next Gen EA Forum 2024

The 2026 forum will once again bring together real-world transformation insights, strategic foresight, and hands-on innovation from across the global Enterprise Architect community.  While the full agenda is currently in development, the program will explore key themes including:

  1. Thriving at the Edge of Human + Machine: clarity, leadership, and decision-making where human capability meets intelligent systems
  2. Architecture as a System, Discipline & Mindsets: operating models, clean core, toolchain, repeatability and mindsets
  3. Strategic Architecture Leadership & Architecture Practice: aligning business and IT for measurable value, long-term impact and establishing architecture practices.
  4. SAP Strategy, Technology & Roadmaps: connecting SAPâ€™s product strategy, platform direction, innovation roadmap, and architectural implications for customers.
  5. Real Life Transformation Journeys: lessons learned from SAP S/4HANA, RISE with SAP, and SAP BTP transformation programs.
  6. Data Inspired and Data Architecture: enabling business context, governance, and intelligent data design.
  7. AI-Driven & Agentic Architectures + AI Augmented Architect: unlocking new levels of insight, automation, adaptability, and real-world autonomous design patterns.
  8. The Future-Ready Architect + Life of an Enterprise Architect: how architects actually work, grow, adapt, and stay relevant â€” inside the reality of the role.
  9. Developing the Next Generation of Architects:  mentoring, pathways, and capability-building to grow future EA talent and multiply impact.
  10. The Human Edge: creativity, storytelling, influence, leadership, and the evolving role of the Enterprise Architect in the age of AI.
 

Once the registrations are open, you can secure your spot early and take advantage of special discounted rates for the Next Generation SAP Enterprise Architect Learning Forum 2026:

  • Super Early Bird â€“ Until December 19, 2025 â€“ $899
  • Early Bird â€“ Until January 30, 2026 â€“ $999
  • Standard Rate â€“ After February 7, 2026 â€“ $1,199

Your registration will include access to all main forum sessions, hands-on deep dives, networking events, and training materials.

Note: If you are interested in sponsoring the event or having a booth, please feel free to reach out to: ea-events@sap.com

Venue Details: SAP America Inc, Newtown Square, 3999 West Chester Pike, Newtown Square, PA 19073, USA

Add Event to you Calendar using this Link
